talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>

$Geraint$
What kind of a loser was I in the past? Hmph.

$Geraint$
I smell Rubinart.

$Geraint$
He said the book is at a corridor, so let's go through the Forest of Little Shadows and go to the Corridor of Tangled Memories.
(Go to Corridor of Tangled Memories through the Forest of Little Shadows)

$Geraint$
He said the book is at a corridor, so let's go to the Corridor of Tangled Memories. We can get there via the Forest of Little Shadows.
(Go to Corridor of Tangled Memories through the Forest of Little Shadows)

$Geraint$
Ewww it's so wet here! I'd rather be scorched by the flames of the Monolith!! Living in such damp places would make even a healthy man sick! And is this even a corridor? It looks like someone made it like this on purpose. A simple ground subsidence wouldn't make it look like this.

${user_nick}$
("Ground subsidence"? Geraint has strangely been saying some clever stuff from just now)

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_01.ogg}
…You're quietly looking down on me again aren't you? I don't like you. Hmph. I just ended up with you because of Argenta. It's not like you're especially strong or what. I wouldn't be travelling with you if you didn't care about Argenta so much, you stupid jellofish….

${user_nick}$
(Jellofish? Is he trying to say jellyfish?)

$Geraint$
Oh yeah, jellyfish not jello… Hey, did you just laught at me? Stop! You stupid!
Ah why did Argenta or the old me have such a bad taste in choosing a companion? If I had the chance to choose... Hmm... I would have chosen someone like….

${user_nick}$
(He's trying to show the kind of person he would have chosen by using his hands, but... What's he trying to say? Maybe he wanted someone smaller? Or maybe he's limited by the length of his arms in describing his ideal companion)

$Geraint$
…Argh! Forget it! I don't know how to describe. Argenta should have taught me when I was just born. Hmph! I would have scolded you with more clever words if I was just a year older. I would have read a lot more books by then.

${user_nick}$
(So you were trying to scold me… But more importantly, did he just say…)
Geraint, do you like books?

$Geraint$
Of course. Do you even need to ask? Books let you know things you don't know.
But Argenta didn't really like me reading those human stuff.

${user_nick}$
Is that right…

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_02.ogg}
Argenta really hated humans. She hated it when I looked at human things or when I talked with humans. She didn't like how humans died so early. Even Elves die much earlier than us so she said don't get too close to them.

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_03.ogg}
She said we are the only ones who'll get hurt if we became too attached to the weak ones.
I know what she means, I understand... We shouldn't care about the weak ones... But...

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_04.ogg}
When I ask about things I don't know and I get an answer like "You don't have to know such things," then I won't even know why I don't have to know such things in the first place. I didn't really like that...

${user_nick}$
……!!!!

${user_nick}$
(Was Argenta trying to protect Geraint from getting hurt by the humans like the old Geraint? Or did she think that what Geraint did for the humans in the past was useless? Or maybe Argenta herself was tormented by her own past…?)

${user_nick}$
(No, this is all in my head. I would never know Argenta's real intentions. But still...)

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_05.ogg}
I... I didn't mean I hated everything!! I just didn't like that... She didn't tell me many things so I read up on them secretly... Though Argenta didn't scold me, she didn't look too happy. By the way, I think I found the book….(Geraint passes you a book that's a little damp)

${user_nick}$
…(Just like what Geraint said, it would be hard to find out why if we don't reveal the real reason… It would be good if I can tell Geraint at least what I know. But would it be against Argenta's wishes? Ah, I don't know...)

${user_nick}$
All right, I'll read it. Erm... this seems to be the right one. Well done, Geraint.
(Geraint seems a little surprised by the unexpected compliment, but he quietly sits down next to you and waits for you to read the book.)

$Rubinart's Book$
Other knights would be furious if you asked them to conquer a place they've never even heard of, but that wasn't the case for Feder. Rather, it seems to have ignited his curiosity about the creatures called the Elves. That was so likely of him...

$Rubinart's Book$
He successfully entered Anu Arendel. Though it was being protected under a spell, Feder brought along a bunch of famous court sorceresses with him with the help from Elizabeth who was also a sorceress and easily broke the spell. The sorceresses were excited too. It was the first time they ever saw an Elf with their own eyes.

$Rubinart's Book$
But it looks like the Elves were afraid. They hid as well as they could and only one came to meet him -- an Elf clad in blue clothes with her eyes shut. It was Meriendel. Feder requested to see the queen of the Elves, but she didn't come out. Actually, the queen of the Elves can't leave her throne because she's bound to the Tree of Life but of course, Feder did not know about this.

$Rubinart's Book$
Since there was only one Elf around, Feder said it would only be fair if he fought by himself. However, the Elves requested a representative from the sorceresses too, so Elizabeth joined. That's how the three of them had a talk.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_01.ogg}
…I never expected an army this big would come to Anu Arendel.
Actually, we have enough strength to fight you. It's just that we don't want unnecessary bloodshed. So the Elves have gone into hiding and I hope you understand that's why I'm receiving you all alone.

$Knight Feder${sound:npc_Pether_9562_qu_01.ogg}
I would have been surprised if I were you too... It's us who should be apologizing for barging into your land with an army without even sending an envoy first. I was pressured to do so and I had to make this whole event look like a grandiose expedition... I apologise for the trouble.

$Archer Meriendel$
….(Meriendel smiles)No wonder. You didn't attack even after breaking the barrier of spells, so I thought you might have your own reasons. Conqueror King Feder, are you planning to conquer Anu Arendel like you've been ordered to do?

$Knight Feder${sound:npc_Pether_9562_qu_02.ogg}
…Honestly, I don't see any point in conquering a land that I'm not even familiar with how it's being ruled. I don't want to make the mistake of waging a war without knowing the size of your enemy too. But I can't return empty-handed either.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_02.ogg}
Then...?

$Knight Feder${sound:npc_Pether_9562_qu_03.ogg}
How about a one-on-one battle? The strongest Elf against the strongest human. Then we will be able to roughly know the true strength of each other. We can promise to grant the winner's wish, and we can keep our dignity and prevent a war.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_03.ogg}
What will you ask for if you win? Though it's highly unlikely that would happen.

$Knight Feder${sound:npc_Pether_9562_qu_04.ogg}
I want to request an alliance and exchange in culture. We don't know each other much. What would yours be?

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_04.ogg}
Keep away from the Elves. We will make make barriers with magic that are much stronger than before, so it won't be easy to come in next time.

$Princess Elizabeth${sound:npc_Elizabeth_9562_qu_01.ogg}
We've only just met, and you're saying we shouldn't meet again...? Don't you feel sad about that? We would be able to help each other. All of us live in the same continent. It's absurd to intentionally make it difficult to meet each other.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_05.ogg}
….(Meriendel smiles again) Huhu, you're interesting. But Elves are different from humans. Take love for example. Humans think it's so natural to fall in love, but that's something very strange to us. Though there are male and female Elves too, we still think it's weird. That's one example how different we are and why I think it would be hard for us to interact.

$Princess Elizabeth${sound:npc_Elizabeth_9562_qu_02.ogg}
I think I can be friends with you.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_06.ogg}
Huhu... I think so too, but... I'm here to represent the Elves and I'm just a convoy...
I'll let the Elves know about your suggestion. But I was surprised I should say... I didn't expect our talk to go so smoothly without raising our voices. I expected you would want an all-out war.

$Knight Feder${sound:npc_Pether_9562_qu_05.ogg}
Is that so... I'm the one who's surprised that there's an Elf who seems to share my thoughts.
Anyway... Violence is just the means, not the goal. War is nothing compared to my goal of unifying the continent.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_07.ogg}
(Meriendel's eyes widen. Though her eyes don't have any focus, they are bright blue and crystal clear. Neither Elizabeth nor Feder are surprised after seeing her eyes... Meriendel closes her eyes again and smiles) Two wonderful people... It would be interesting to see you become the ruler of this continent... I'll see you again soon.

$Rubinart's Book$
The Elves accepted Feder's suggestion and they came out of their hiding. Their representative came out too, and it was none other than Meriendel. Feder was surprised. Well, Meriendel was blind. But Feder later mentioned that Meriendel said this to him.

$Archer Meriendel${sound:npc_Marriendel_9562_qu_08.ogg}
The blind have their own ways to become stronger, and I have reached the peak of strength and skills or even beyond that.
King of humans, you will witness the strength of the most powerful Elf in the world.

$Rubinart's Book$
And her warnings weren't empty... The two of them fought for days and nights over a week without a break. Can you imagine that? Well, I can't because most creatures would die at a flick of my finger, but for a normal human and Elf to fight for a week is crazy. It's something that can only be done with crazy stamina and mental strength.

$Rubinart's Book$
And by a slight margin, Meriendel lost... It's funny how she lost too. It was because her bow broke. Meriendel held out for two more days just using the arrows. But her wooden arrows were no match for Feder's steel sword. Both the humans and the Elves acknowledged this battle, and the two started their formal interaction.

$Rubinart's Book$
But the humans kept pestering for a proof of conquer... So the queen of the Elves even invited Feder inside the Tree of Life!! This was something totally exceptional and will probably never happen again. Feder was shocked when he saw the queen of the Elves and was once again reminded how magical the Elves were.

$Rubinart's Book$
The queen of the Elves told Feder that since the Elves lost, he could request for any treasure that he wanted and she would grant it if it was within her means. However, Feder refused to take any Elf stuff, saying that they would be the ones who would take the best care of their own stuff. Instead, he requested for a hostage.

$Rubinart's Book$
He requested for Meriendel, the strongest Elf.

$Rubinart's Book$
The queen hesitated a little. It would be a loss for the Elves to let their best fighter go. However, Meriendel was curious to know more about the humans, so she thought it would be a good idea for her to learn about them while she was being held as a hostage and later come back and teach the Elves about humans. So she agreed, and Meriendel was happy about it too.

$Rubinart's Book$
Well... Afterwards, there were things like the Water Spirit incident, so the ties between the humans and the Elves were severed. But Meriendel remained by Feder's side. That's why some Elves called her a traitor. I don't know if she's still called that way at the time you're reading this.

$Rubinart's Book$
But she wouldn't have known it herself too... That the feelings between two humans, something that she said she couldn't understand, would act as a biggest hindrance to her. Well... I'll tell you about this later, my friend. It would be something hard for you to understand anyway. You are wise, but you were born later than me.

$Rubinart's Book$
If I write down everything I know in words, I believe you would be able to feel what I felt at that time... So the next book is... Well, I can't find any empty notebooks here... I can't travel around this place any longer so I should go back to where I used to live. I think I have some empty books there.

$Rubinart's Book$
I'm sure you know where that is.
I'll continue the story on how I met them in the next book…
(The book has ended. Talk to Geraint)

${user_nick}$
Hmm... I didn't expect Meriendel would have met Feder like this.
And Feder's... rather different from the person he is now. How did someone like him become the king of the Dragon Followers…

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_06.ogg}
Huh… So Feder was like this? He's a teeny-weeny bit... cool... Why did a guy like him end up wreaking havoc in the Monolith? What changed him?

${user_nick}$
Erm... I heard that he was devastated when he heard from Meriendel that this world is nothing but a dream... I think that's what changed him. People change when they find out too many things.

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_07.ogg}
Then I'm no different from a human, eh? I changed too.
Then why do you keep wanting to see the old me? I changed because I went through many things and that's a very natural for humans too.
Why is it that it's okay for him and not me?!

${user_nick}$
Erm... That's a different issue actually...

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_08.ogg}
Even if you like the old me better, I can't go back 'cos I can't remember anything.

${user_nick}$
(Could it be that he took it to his heart when I compared him with the old Geraint?)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>No, I didn't mean it that way…</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_09.ogg}
Er, no. Is it weird for a dragon to be like a human? Argh, forget it.
My mind's in a mess again. It's all because of you!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I don't think I changed that much…</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_10.ogg}
Hey, why are you reacting that way?(Geraint seems to find your reaction strange)
You've changed too. What should I do if you change so quickly?
<html>$Quest Reward$</html>

$Geraint${sound:npc_GeraintKid_9562_qu_11.ogg}
You don't even know that you've changed? You stupid. (Geraint sneers at you)
How did an idiot like you run errands for Argenta?

$Geraint$
So we have to find the next book don't we? I smell it over there. It's coming from that way. (Geraint is pointing to the Passage of Broken Recollections. Go there via the Forest of Little Shadows.)

journal.title: The Elf and the Knight 1
journal.contents:
Go to Corridor of Tangled Memories and talk to Geraint.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Corridor of Tangled Memories (Geraint)
journal.destination: To the Corridor of Tangled Memories
journal.todo_msg: Quest has been added. Go to Corridor of Tangled Memories.

journal.title: The Elf and the Knight 2
journal.contents:
Geraint found the book... Take a look.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Corridor of Tangled Memories (Geraint)
journal.destination: Read the book at the Corridor of Tangled Memories

journal.title: The Elf and the Knight 3
journal.contents:
The book has ended. Feder has wisely resolved the absurd order to conquer Anu Arendel,
improved the relations with the Elves, and gained Meriendel as his subordinate.
Talk to Geraint.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Corridor of Tangled Memories (Geraint)
journal.destination: Talk to Geraint at Corridor of Tangled Memories
